ppak.cret.connector

Class ApiDataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • ppak.cret.connector.ApiDataProvider

  • public class ApiDataProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Class providing list of cities and current weather information to FrameController
    See Also:
    FrameController

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApiDataProvider()
      Constructor initializing the object and setting list of cities with default values

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCity(java.lang.String city)
      Add new city for which FrameController creates record in combox.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCitiesList()
      Gets all cities for which FrameController creates record in combox List of cities contains "London,uk","Cracow,pl", "NewYork,us" as default values
      Weather getNewData(java.lang.String city)
      Establishes connection with OpenWeatherMap service, downloads current weather information for @param city and base on this creates and returns new Weather object.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApiDataProvider

        public ApiDataProvider()
        Constructor initializing the object and setting list of cities with default values

    • Method Detail

      • getCitiesList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCitiesList()
        Gets all cities for which FrameController creates record in combox List of cities contains "London,uk","Cracow,pl", "NewYork,us" as default values
        Returns:
        list of cities
        See Also:
        FrameController

      • addCity

        public void addCity(java.lang.String city)
        Add new city for which FrameController creates record in combox.
        Parameters:
        city - String object representing city's name
        See Also:
        FrameController

      • getNewData

        public Weather getNewData(java.lang.String city)
        Establishes connection with OpenWeatherMap service, downloads current weather information for @param city and base on this creates and returns new Weather object. Later FrameController uses this object to reload data.
        Parameters:
        city - for which weather information should be download
        Returns:
        Weather object based on current weather information for @param city
        See Also:
        Weather, FrameController
